Keywords: Java open source software, free accounting software, Java reporting tools, PDF creator, Java PDF library, Jetty for Android, Java ORM library, JSP, JSTL, JSON, AJAX.
Products:
Beigesoft ™ Accounting
Beigesoft ™ Accounting is JEE-WEB based Accounting software.
It works as:
Standalone WEB-application on embedded private WEB-server A-Jetty for standard Java (Ms Windows, Mac, *Nix...).
Standalone WEB-application on embedded A-Jetty for Android.
Standard JEE web-application on any JEE server (cloud).
It requires Google Chrome, Opera, or Chromium browser (html5-dialog ready).
Features:
Double entries accounting system include ledger and balance reports.
COGS FIFO/LIFO perpetual automatically for sales, sales returns, inventory loses.
Automatically sales taxes accounting entries (a goods may has several sales taxes) for sales, purchase invoice and their returns.
Prepayments/payments tracking for sales/purchases.
Payroll - automatically taxes calculation (by percentage tax table method) and accounting entries.
Manufacturing - automatically cost calculation from used materials and direct labor (and other) costs.
Multi-databases (organizations) on standalone web-app version which uses SQlite database.
and more.
See Beige Accounting Privacy Policy.
See Beigesoft™ digital signatures.
See Beige Accounting Bob's Pizza example.
Since version 1.1.5 Beige-Accounting standalone versions are always in secure enabled mode, that is it uses encrypted (HTTPS) connection, it requires strong password for authorization, it also uses encryption (modern algorithm RSA with 2048bit key and 256bit AES) for safe file (SQLite databases) exchanging between computers/tablets, e.g. accountant can send encrypted SQLite database to business owner, and no one can decrypt it except owner.
Beige-Accounting for MS Windows/Mac/*Nix beigesoft-accountingoio-ajetty.bin.zip and cloud version beigesoft-accounting-weboio.war and other products you can find in central Maven repository https://search.maven.org/#search%7Cga%7C1%7Cg%3A%22org.beigesoft%22 or https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/beigesoft/beigesoft-accountingoio-ajetty/
Beige-Accounting for Android comply rules https://play.google.com/about/privacy-security/personal-sensitive/, so you can find it in Google Play-Store.
Source code of Beige-Accounting and other products you can find in https://github.com/demidenko05

Beigesoft ™ PDF Writer.
This is light-weight (all JARs size is about 250KB), international friendly and fast PDF writer. It's cross-platform writer - Standard Java and Android.
Benefits:
Ready for high load job. Speed test (thread per invoice) results shows that making 100 invoices (3pages each) takes less than 4 seconds on ordinal notebook. Invoice file size is 26KB cause embed TTF font has only used characters.
There are not 3-d party libraries. Beigesoft ™ Document Writer, Swing/Android graphics libraries, Logger are licensed under free GPLv2. Every day English language is polluted with new words that duplicate old ones, and old words are polluted with new meanings, so there are "free open source software" that are actually non-free. In other hand there are free software that have not noticed that "it has dependencies with non-three licenses" (truly free license always means "forever").
Although Beigesoft ™ PDF Writer hasn't yet implemented graphic charts and other features, and it has no visual editor, it's really enough to create complex black and white (include non-masked RGB images) business reports quickly. Visual editor is planned to be the same as MS Word or LibreOffice Writer. Here are PDF files for example: Invoice sample Счет-фактура Платежное поручение
A-Jetty
A-Jetty is Jetty 9.2 adapted for Android, it can run precompiled JSP/JSTL.
Features:
It can run on Android Java as well as on standard Java 7+.
It can perform precompiled by A-Tomcat JSP/JSTL.
JSP(plus JSTL) is the same WEB-view technology as ASPX, PHP and deprecated ASP. JSP and ASPX are faster than PHP and ASP cause they are compiled into byte-code which is performed by Java VM or DOT.NET. PHP, ASP are text that is interpreted during runtime and they are never compiled. All these technology used to build complex WEB-interface quickly.
Using JSP(JSTL) allow you to create exactly multiplatform WEB-applications cause A-Jetty can run them. The best way of using A-Jetty is use it as embedded server in standalone WEB-application.
Beigesoft ™ ORM
Beige-ORM is lightweight multiplatform (Android Java and standard Java 7+) ORM library.
It supports Postgresql, MySql, H2 and SQlite (adding a new RDBMS is very simple task).
For mapping it uses standard Java XML properties files.
It has implemented optimistic locking by version (autoincrement and last changed time).
Since version 1.1.4 it supports automatically (create, insert, update) complex models e.g. WarehouseRests {WarewouseSite, Item, UnitOfMeasure, quantity} where triple (WarewouseSite, Item, UnitOfMeasure) is composite ID. Another example GoodsRating{Goods, rating} where Goods is primary and foreign ID.
It retrieve almost full model through 2 level. E.g. an retrieved Invoice has already retrieved Customer(1st level), but in this Customer CustomerCategory (2-nd level) has only ID.
It hasn't implemented refresh owned entity by invoke getter. So you have to invoke explicitly ORM refresh e.g.:
customerInvoice.getCustomer().setCustomerCategory(getSrvOrm() .retrieveEntity(customerInvoice.getCustomer().getCustomerCategory()));
It never retrieved owned entities-list, e.g. InvoiceLines, you should do it explicitly:
SalesInvoiceLine sil = new SalesInvoiceLine(); sil.setItsOwner(salesInvoice); salesInvoice.setItsLines(getSrvOrm().retrieveListForField(pAddParam, sil, "itsOwner"));
These lines are retrieved also through 2 level by big SQL query.
Standard ORM use lazy-initialization of model by default. So they retrieve model by several SQL queries and JDBC connection used during whole HTTP request-response. This is no good for performance. Beige-ORM retrieve a customer invoice with 15 lines by 2 SQL queries (one for body, another for lines) then close connection and pass model to viewer (renderer). Standard ORM make 1 SQL request for body, 1 for customer, 1 for lines, 15 for every line goods, 15 for every line unit of measure. Two big SQL queries (exactly with joins) is faster than several (33 in this case) small ones. Any RDMBS is optimized (must be) to perform big SQL queries that returns a lot of data. SQL queries without joins is bad practice that hit performance e.g.:
select SALESINVOICE.ITSDATE, DEBTORCREDITOR.ITSNAME from SALESINVOICE, DEBTORCREDITOR where SALESINVOICE.ITSID=1 and DEBTORCREDITOR.ITSID=SALESINVOICE.CUSTOMER
Beige-ORM never alter tables, only create new ones, but it has reliable mean - invoke upgrade_[new_version].sql script when Beige-ORM is started. Beige-ORM required database must has ID and VERSION table, this is holds in model org.beigesoft.persistable.DatabaseInfo. Upgrade script can upgrade tables (alters, insert, updates...) and must set new database version. So task "add DebtorCreditor.spetialCategory, not null" is trivial for Beige-ORM, not for standard ORM:
alter table DebtorCreditor add column specialCategory integer; insert into CPECIALCATEGORY values (1, 'cat A'); ... update DebtorCreditor [for specialCategory] ... alter table DebtorCreditor alter column spetialCategory integer not null; update DATABASEINFO set DATABASEVERSION=[new_version], DESCRIPTION='database upgraded' where DATABASEID=[DB_ID];
Beige-WEB.
Beige-WEB is CRUD WEB-application based on JSP, JSTL, JSON, AJAX.
With it you can build complex WEB interface with no time. It renders forms (include entity pickers) and lists of any entity according XML settings. Beige-Accounting use it.
It uses BeigeSettings to describe how to render an entity and its fields, e.g. beige-uvd/fieldTypeToFs/wdgNewForm.xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd"> <properties> <comment>Correspondence of Java types to widget base names. ORDER is essential, the LAST value will be used</comment> <entry key="java.lang.Integer">inputNumber</entry> <entry key="java.lang.Long">inputNumber</entry> <entry key="java.lang.Float">inputReal</entry> <entry key="java.lang.Double">inputReal</entry> <entry key="java.lang.String">inputString</entry> <entry key="java.lang.Boolean">inputBoolean</entry> <entry key="java.util.Date">inputDateTime</entry> <entry key="java.math.BigDecimal">inputPrice</entry> <entry key="java.lang.Enum">inputEnum</entry> <entry key="org.beigesoft.model.IHasName">inputEntityHasName</entry> <entry key="org.beigesoft.accounting.persistable.Account">inputAccount</entry> <entry key="org.beigesoft.accounting.persistable.IDoc">inputDocument</entry> </properties>
It use cheap JSON multi-target responses created by JSP, for example after document was accounted:
<%@ page language="java" contentType="application/json; charset=UTF-8" pageEncoding="UTF-8"%> <%@ taglib prefix="c" uri="http://java.sun.com/jsp/jstl/core" %> <c:set var="namePlaceForm" value="frmMainPlace" scope="request"/> {"multiTargetResponse": [{"nameTarget": "${namePlaceForm}", "content": "", "nameTargetParent": null, "javascript": null}, <c:set var="fltOrdPrefix" value="fltordM" scope="request"/> <c:set var="namePlace" value="lstMainPlace" scope="request"/> <c:set var="showSuccess" value="showSuccess(MSGS['account_successful']);"/> <c:set var="nameRendererList" value="listJson" scope="request"/> <c:import url="/WEB-INF/jsp/list.jsp" varReader="rdEntities" charEncoding="UTF-8"> {"nameTarget": "${namePlace}list", "content": "${utlJsp.toJsonStringAndClose(rdEntities)}", "nameTargetParent": null, "javascript": "${utlJsp.toJsonString(showSuccess)}"}] } </c:import>
This response clear entity form, refresh entity list and show successful message.
Beige-Replicator.
Beige-Replicator replicate/persist any entity according XML settings and user's requirements with a file or network (HTTP). Right now it has implemented XML format of stored/transferred data. Beige-Accounting use it to import full database copy with WEB-service.
Beige-Settings.
Beige-Settings helps to make quickly settings for class and its fields with properties XML. Instead of create a lot of files to describe every class and its fields it use describing by type, by name, e.g. setting "java.lang.Integer"-"INTEGER NOT NULL" will be assigned for every field of this type. Beige-ORM, Beige-WEB, Beige-Replicator use it.
* Address http://www.beigesoft.org was switched off for security (safety) reasons. HTML page come to your browser by passing through several intermediate Internet servers. If any intermediate server is affected by harmful software then it can change content and inject harmful script into HTML page because HTTP is an unencrypted transport.
